abstract: A graph shows how frequently people have searched Google for the term “deflation” in recent years.
snippet: A graph shows how frequently people have searched Google for the term “deflation” in recent years.
lead_paragraph: So are many Googlers. Today Greg Mankiw posted a Google Trends graph showing how frequently Web surfers have searched for the word “deflation” over the last several years.

abstract: AT&T is backing a new group to look at online privacy. Will the battle against Google undercut an important discussion?
snippet: AT&T is backing a new group to look at online privacy. Will the battle against Google undercut an important discussion?
lead_paragraph: When I first read about the formation of a new privacy think tank in Washington financed initially by AT&T, my first instinct was to see it in light of the company’s battle against Google. And I do think that is part of the story, but I also think the new group has the potential to do some real good.

headline.main: Does AT&T’s Newfound Interest in Privacy Hurt Google?

abstract: A public debate on whether Google violates its motto “Don’t be evil” moves quickly to considering whether the search company is guilty of the Seven Deadly Sins.
snippet: A public debate on whether Google violates its motto “Don’t be evil” moves quickly to considering whether the search company is guilty of the Seven Deadly Sins.
lead_paragraph: UPDATE: A follow up to this post is here. Video clips of the debate on are here.

headline.main: Debating the Vices and Virtues of Google

abstract: A new feature lets Google users change the results they see for specific Google searches and revisit their changes later.
snippet: A new feature lets Google users change the results they see for specific Google searches and revisit their changes later.
lead_paragraph: Google is set on Thursday to significantly change the way some people use its search engine.
